item.title: Report X-2023080814
item.description:
Report X-2023080814

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon inspection, there are four 4-liter glass bottles of Acetonitrile inside a fiberboard box. One of the glass bottles shattered causing the liquid to leak throughout the box. The box shows wet stains from the leakage. DescribePack: One of the 4-liter glass bottles shattered. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: shattered glass was placed in a hazardous material plastic bag.

item.title: Report X-2023080788
item.description:
Report X-2023080788

  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the sunrise sort, the box arrived at the hazmat cage with wet conditions. Upon inspection, the package with1 of 4 bottles containing "Advantage chemicals oven & grill cleaner" was discovered to have a loose cap. Package was placed into a salvage drum to be returned to the shipper unless otherwise. DescribePack: The package failure was due to a loose cap on 1 out of 4 of the plastic bottles. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately tightened and placed into a salvage drum to await disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023080778
item.description:
Report X-2023080778

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-07
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon inspection, there are 6 glass bottles of Toluene. Each bottle is packed inside a small box that were overpacked inside a larger box. All of the caps were loose causing the liquid to leak throughout the fiberboard box. Due to each box being wet, the packing tape came off the top and bottom of the boxes. DescribePack: The cap was loose on all the glass bottles. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: All the glass bottles were put in a hazardous material plastic bag.

The caps were loose on 5 of the bottles causing the cleaning solution to leak throughout the box. The packaging has liquid stains all around the inside and outisde of the box. DescribePack: The caps were loose on 5 of the plastic bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Plastic bottles were put inside a hazardous material plastic bag.

item.title: Report X-2023081898
item.description:
Report X-2023081898

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A van unloader was unloading the hazmat and accidently dropped the hazmat onto the ground and caused the lid to come loose and cause the hazmat to have the internal leakage. Immediate action was taken on the hazmat. DescribePack: 1 fiberboard box, flammable liquid package. Cap came off and caused the internal leakage. Package has been dropped by the van unloader. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was secured, repackaged in a salvage drum and awaiting deposition from PGH.

item.title: Report E-2023080601
item.description:
Report E-2023080601

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: WALL TOWNSHIP
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 4, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1814 were crushed during transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel overpacked the damaged drums in one (1) 55-gallon drum, then dismantled the impacted pallet. The crew used absorbent pads to wipe down the impacted surfaces and contained all clean up material in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at hazmat cage during the day sort in a plastic salvage drum. DescribePack: Inspection showed package of "FISHER SCIENTIFIC TRIETHLAMINE" to be wet with closures open. Inner content was broken, most likely caused from being dropped. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Remains of content will be disposed of in a salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2023080717
item.description:
Report X-2023080717

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD PROCESS THE MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND IMMEDIATELY TOOK PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE IT AND VENTILATE IT. I THEN PROPERLY REPACKED IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM AND AM AWAITING THE DISPOSITION FROM PGH. DescribePack: THERE WAS A LOOSE CAP ON ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES CAUSING THAT ONE BOTTLE TO LEAK APPROXIMATELY 1/2 CUP OUT ONTO THE OTHER BOTTLES AND THE PACKAGE ITSELF WHICH THEN IN TURN MADE THE BOX ALL WET. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: TAKING PACKAGE IMMEDIATELY TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. THEN REPACKING IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY MANNER.

item.title: Report X-2023080716
item.description:
Report X-2023080716

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: DOVER
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During sort package came from unload leaking wet with strong odor. Observed package is a regulated Hazmat. Further inspection confirmed inner bottle of muriatic acid has small crack due to a dent in one of the bottles. No partition or packing used to protect inner containers. DescribePack: Small crack developed in 1 of the 4 bottles. The leak due to its corrosive nature of liquid destroyed bottom of box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: once identified, the package was separated from other sort items and placed in a hazmat bag and bin.

item.title: Report X-2023080714
item.description:
Report X-2023080714

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: DOVER
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came down conveyer belt on van line appearing wet/open at end. Box was isolated from sort by belt manager and placed in a red hazmat bin with plastic hazmat bag liner. Belt manager notified QA. Small amount of leakage on belt was cleaned by belt manager with absorbent disposable towels. DescribePack: Package is wet/torn open on one end; it appears that the leak caused the tear. Package appears damp on sides. Package has no puncture marks or tears besides torn open end. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately removed from conveyer belt and placed into a red hazmat bin lined with a plastic hazmat bag. Belt manager wiped small amount of leakage from conveyer belt with absorbent disposable towels. QA was notified.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE ARRIVED DURING THE SUNRISE SORT IN A PLASTIC BIN. DescribePack: Inspection showed the package of "ECOLAB CO AQUA BALANCE MURIATIC ACID" was wet and torn open from 1 inner container being burst open. Damage most likely occurred from being dropped. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: The damaged content will be disposed of and the remaining contents will be sent back to the shipper, unless otherwise stated.

item.title: Report E-2023080210
item.description:
Report E-2023080210

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: MANVILLE
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 08/01/2023, at 10:52 hours, A FRA inspector in the CSXT Manville yard discovered the SHPX222886, a residue tank car of Waste Flammable Liquid, having a vapor release from the top of the car. The rail car was isolated and the shipper, GEOCYCLE, was notified via the waybill’s emergency contact number (877-818-0087). MEI, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the car was releasing product vapor due to a faulty vacuum relief valve (VRV). Contractor personnel removed the faulty VRV and installed a pipe plug to stop the release. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative- Marvin Sparks (843-826-1746, marvin.sparks@geocycle.com). The car was held at this location pending further repair and qualification by a certified mobile repair unit or receipt of One Time Move Approval from the FRA.

DescribePack: CONTAINER LEAKED FROM A LOOSE CAP DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED FROM THE TRUCK AND IT WAS NOTICED BOX WAS WET. BOX WAS TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT CAGE, SECURED, REPACKED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION FROM PGH.

item.title: Report X-2023081111
item.description:
Report X-2023081111

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGR NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND IMMEDIATELY TOOK PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE. MANAGER THEN PROPERLY SECURED AND VENTILATED PACKAGE. I THEN GOT CALLED OVER TO REPACK THIS PACKAGE INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM. DescribePack: THERE WAS FOUR BOTTLES INSIDE THIS PACKAGE. TWO OUT OF THE FOUR HAD LOOSE CAPS ON THEM CAUSING THEM TO LEAK OUT ONTO THE OTHER BOTTLES AND THE BOX ITSELF MAKING THE PACKAGE WET. APPROXIMATELY 2 CUPS LEAKED OUT DUE TO THOSE LOOSE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE MANAGER TAKING IT OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT. I THEN REPACKED IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM SAFELY, PROPERLY AND IN A TIMELY MANNER. I AM NOW AWAITING FOR THE DISPOSITION FROM PGH.

Once inspected it looked like it had been dropped prior upon arrival, if you take a look at the tracking, it was bouncing all around. DescribePack: at the bottom of the can you can see dents and a puncture hole that the liquid is leaking out from. DurationRel: 700 and MitigateEffect: was given QA attention and was placed inside of HAZ TOTE.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was brought over to the QA area for investigation due to the box being went on the bottom. A QA team member realized the ISOPROPANOL was leaking from one bottle during the investigation. The QA manager as well as P&D and the safety manager was then made aware of the damaged hazmat. DescribePack: The aluminum seal was broken and the cap was loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The cap was placed back on correctly

item.title: Report X-2023080649
item.description:
Report X-2023080649

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: DOVER
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Original HESS #100509 - orig. date entered 7/28 - incorrectly cancelled - re-entered 8/3 - Box found on van line wet/oily and smelling strongly of lemon cleaner. Box was removed from van line for inspection and placed into a red hazmat bin with plastic liner to contain potential leak. Bin/box were brought to QA cage for inspection. DescribePack: Box appears crushed in on top corner and oily/wet from leak, but is not actually punctured/torn. Outer package contains 2 inner boxes, with 12 aerosol cans placed in each. One corner of both the outer and inner boxes appears crushed inward. Outer and inner boxes appear otherwise undamaged. This was likely crush/drop damage and not caused outright by any poor or inadequate packaging. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was removed from van line and placed into a red hazmat bin lined with plastic hazmat liner. Box and bin were removed to QA cage for inspection.

Report X-2023080340

  • Description: PACKAGE DISCOVERED ON THE DMP TABLE WITH DAMP SPOTS VISIBLE ON OUTSIDE OF BOX, DMP CLERK FOLLOWED LEAKING PACKAGE DECISION TREE, HAZARDOUS RESPONSE SHEETS, AND DISPOSAL CHART PROCEDURE.
